<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If &#95;MSC&#95;VER is defined, we must have SEH. Use it if it&#39;s available. It&#39;s way</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="189"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// better than VEH. Vectored exception handling catches all exceptions happening</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="190"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// on the thread with installed exception handlers, so it can interfere with</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="191"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// internal exception handling of other libraries on that thread. SEH works</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// exactly as you would expect normal exception handling to work: it only</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#95;&#95;except.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This is a non-MSVC compiler, probably mingw gcc or clang without</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// -fms-extensions. Use vectored exception handling (VEH).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// On Windows, we can make use of vectored exception handling to catch most</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// crashing situations.  Note that this does mean we will be alerted of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// exceptions &#42;before&#42; structured exception handling has the opportunity to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// catch it. Unfortunately, this causes problems in practice with other code</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// running on threads with LLVM crash recovery contexts, so we would like to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// eventually move away from VEH.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Vectored works on a per-thread basis, which is an advantage over</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// SetUnhandledExceptionFilter. SetUnhandledExceptionFilter also doesn&#39;t have</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// any native support for chaining exception handlers, but VEH allows more than</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// one.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The vectored exception handler functionality was added in Windows</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// XP, so if support for older versions of Windows is required,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// it will have to be added.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="297"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const&#95;cast&lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">CrashRecoveryContextImpl &#42;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(CRCI)-&gt;HandleCrash(</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="299"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="300"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Note that we don&#39;t actually get here because HandleCrash calls</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="301"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// longjmp, which means the HandleCrash function never returns.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="302"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/errorhandling-h/#ace243f5c25697a1107cce46626b3dc94">llvm&#95;unreachable</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Handled the crash, should have longjmp&#39;ed out of here&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="303"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="304"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="305"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Because the Enable and Disable calls are static, it means that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="306"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// there may not actually be an Impl available, or even a current</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="307"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// CrashRecoveryContext at all.  So we make use of a thread-local</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="308"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// exception table.  The handles contained in here will either be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// non-NULL, valid VEH handles, or NULL.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="310"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/compiler-h/#a793005af6ae802d5a2a2e8ceb4ac2135">LLVM&#95;THREAD&#95;LOCAL</a> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#42; sCurrentExceptionHandle;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="311"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="312"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="#afafe7a6e51a65dc858e161f5f0346eb7">installExceptionOrSignalHandlers</a>() &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="313"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We can set up vectored exception handling now.  We will install our</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="314"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// handler as the front of the list, though there&#39;s no assurances that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="315"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// it will remain at the front (another call could install itself before</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="316"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// our handler).  This 1) isn&#39;t likely, and 2) shouldn&#39;t cause problems.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317"><Highlight kind="normal">  PVOID handle = ::AddVectoredExceptionHandler(1, ExceptionHandler);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><Highlight kind="normal">  sCurrentExceptionHandle = handle;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="#a72432dde4ac5721bf8d78d090a198dc6">uninstallExceptionOrSignalHandlers</a>() &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"><Highlight kind="normal">  PVOID currentHandle = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const&#95;cast&lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">PVOID</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(sCurrentExceptionHandle);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (currentHandle) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Now we can remove the vectored exception handler from the chain</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="325"><Highlight kind="normal">    ::RemoveVectoredExceptionHandler(currentHandle);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Reset the handle in our thread-local set.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><Highlight kind="normal">    sCurrentExceptionHandle = NULL;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="330"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="331"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="332"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#else </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// !&#95;WIN32</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="333"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="334"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Generic POSIX implementation.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="335"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="336"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This implementation relies on synchronous signals being delivered to the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// current thread. We use a thread local object to keep track of the active</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// crash recovery context, and install signal handlers to invoke HandleCrash on</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the active object.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This implementation does not attempt to chain signal handlers in any</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="342"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// reliable fashion -- if we get a signal outside of a crash recovery context we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="343"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// simply disable crash recovery and raise the signal again.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="344"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="345"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#include &lt;signal.h&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="346"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="347" lineLink="#a610cf56a4e6ab035bbce5e4bd4b35491"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="#a610cf56a4e6ab035bbce5e4bd4b35491">Signals</a>&#91;&#93; =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="348"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#123; SIGABRT, SIGBUS, SIGFPE, SIGILL, SIGSEGV, SIGTRAP &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="349" lineLink="#a2c9e1adb1243628fba0a85d1679c5408"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="#a2c9e1adb1243628fba0a85d1679c5408">NumSignals</a> = std::size(<a href="#a610cf56a4e6ab035bbce5e4bd4b35491">Signals</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="350" lineLink="#a78ca6b94aa2c38681accbf6cfbd577e6"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">sigaction <a href="#a78ca6b94aa2c38681accbf6cfbd577e6">PrevActions</a>&#91;<a href="#a2c9e1adb1243628fba0a85d1679c5408">NumSignals</a>&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="351"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="352" lineLink="#a63942c4dec8efd06218370c042a12480"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="#a63942c4dec8efd06218370c042a12480">CrashRecoverySignalHandler</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Signal) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="353"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Lookup the current thread local recovery object.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="354"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> CrashRecoveryContextImpl &#42;CRCI = CurrentContext;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00355" /><CodeLine lineNumber="355"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00356" /><CodeLine lineNumber="356"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!CRCI) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00357" /><CodeLine lineNumber="357"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We didn&#39;t find a crash recovery context -- this means either we got a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00358" /><CodeLine lineNumber="358"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// signal on a thread we didn&#39;t expect it on, the application got a signal</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="359"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// outside of a crash recovery context, or something else went horribly</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00360" /><CodeLine lineNumber="360"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// wrong.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00361" /><CodeLine lineNumber="361"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00362" /><CodeLine lineNumber="362"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Disable crash recovery and raise the signal again. The assumption here is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00363" /><CodeLine lineNumber="363"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that the enclosing application will terminate soon, and we won&#39;t want to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00364" /><CodeLine lineNumber="364"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// attempt crash recovery again.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00365" /><CodeLine lineNumber="365"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00366" /><CodeLine lineNumber="366"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This call of Disable isn&#39;t thread safe, but it doesn&#39;t actually matter.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00367" /><CodeLine lineNumber="367"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontext/#a85c3b9e248b6ed94762938f8cac81a49">CrashRecoveryContext::Disable</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00368" /><CodeLine lineNumber="368"><Highlight kind="normal">    raise(Signal);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00369" /><CodeLine lineNumber="369"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00370" /><CodeLine lineNumber="370"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The signal will be thrown once the signal mask is restored.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00371" /><CodeLine lineNumber="371"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00372" /><CodeLine lineNumber="372"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00373" /><CodeLine lineNumber="373"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00374" /><CodeLine lineNumber="374"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Unblock the signal we received.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00375" /><CodeLine lineNumber="375"><Highlight kind="normal">  sigset&#95;t SigMask;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00376" /><CodeLine lineNumber="376"><Highlight kind="normal">  sigemptyset(&amp;SigMask);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00377" /><CodeLine lineNumber="377"><Highlight kind="normal">  sigaddset(&amp;SigMask, Signal);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00378" /><CodeLine lineNumber="378"><Highlight kind="normal">  sigprocmask(SIG&#95;UNBLOCK, &amp;SigMask, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00379" /><CodeLine lineNumber="379"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00380" /><CodeLine lineNumber="380"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Return the same error code as if the program crashed, as mentioned in the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00381" /><CodeLine lineNumber="381"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// section &quot;Exit Status for Commands&quot;:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00382" /><CodeLine lineNumber="382"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// https://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/xrat/V4&#95;xcu&#95;chap02.html</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00383" /><CodeLine lineNumber="383"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> RetCode = 128 + Signal;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00384" /><CodeLine lineNumber="384"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00385" /><CodeLine lineNumber="385"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Don&#39;t consider a broken pipe as a crash (see clang/lib/Driver/Driver.cpp)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00386" /><CodeLine lineNumber="386"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Signal == SIGPIPE)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00387" /><CodeLine lineNumber="387"><Highlight kind="normal">    RetCode = EX&#95;IOERR;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00388" /><CodeLine lineNumber="388"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00389" /><CodeLine lineNumber="389"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (CRCI)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00390" /><CodeLine lineNumber="390"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const&#95;cast&lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">CrashRecoveryContextImpl &#42;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(CRCI)-&gt;HandleCrash(RetCode, Signal);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00391" /><CodeLine lineNumber="391"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00392" /><CodeLine lineNumber="392"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00393" /><CodeLine lineNumber="393" lineLink="#afafe7a6e51a65dc858e161f5f0346eb7"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="#afafe7a6e51a65dc858e161f5f0346eb7">installExceptionOrSignalHandlers</a>() &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00394" /><CodeLine lineNumber="394"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Setup the signal handler.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00395" /><CodeLine lineNumber="395"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">sigaction Handler;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00396" /><CodeLine lineNumber="396"><Highlight kind="normal">  Handler.sa&#95;handler = <a href="#a63942c4dec8efd06218370c042a12480">CrashRecoverySignalHandler</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00397" /><CodeLine lineNumber="397"><Highlight kind="normal">  Handler.sa&#95;flags = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00398" /><CodeLine lineNumber="398"><Highlight kind="normal">  sigemptyset(&amp;Handler.sa&#95;mask);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00399" /><CodeLine lineNumber="399"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00400" /><CodeLine lineNumber="400"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> i = 0; i != <a href="#a2c9e1adb1243628fba0a85d1679c5408">NumSignals</a>; ++i) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00401" /><CodeLine lineNumber="401"><Highlight kind="normal">    sigaction(<a href="#a610cf56a4e6ab035bbce5e4bd4b35491">Signals</a>&#91;i&#93;, &amp;Handler, &amp;<a href="#a78ca6b94aa2c38681accbf6cfbd577e6">PrevActions</a>&#91;i&#93;);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00402" /><CodeLine lineNumber="402"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00403" /><CodeLine lineNumber="403"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00404" /><CodeLine lineNumber="404"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00405" /><CodeLine lineNumber="405" lineLink="#a72432dde4ac5721bf8d78d090a198dc6"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="#a72432dde4ac5721bf8d78d090a198dc6">uninstallExceptionOrSignalHandlers</a>() &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00406" /><CodeLine lineNumber="406"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Restore the previous signal handlers.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00407" /><CodeLine lineNumber="407"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> i = 0; i != <a href="#a2c9e1adb1243628fba0a85d1679c5408">NumSignals</a>; ++i)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00408" /><CodeLine lineNumber="408"><Highlight kind="normal">    sigaction(<a href="#a610cf56a4e6ab035bbce5e4bd4b35491">Signals</a>&#91;i&#93;, &amp;<a href="#a78ca6b94aa2c38681accbf6cfbd577e6">PrevActions</a>&#91;i&#93;, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00409" /><CodeLine lineNumber="409"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00410" /><CodeLine lineNumber="410"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="411"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#endif </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// !&#95;WIN32</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00412" /><CodeLine lineNumber="412"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00413" /><CodeLine lineNumber="413" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontext/#a7a27e5f3ab2b30dd6b1ef4c8d7e9e5a4"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontext/#a7a27e5f3ab2b30dd6b1ef4c8d7e9e5a4">CrashRecoveryContext::RunSafely</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function-ref">function&#95;ref</a>&lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">()&gt; Fn) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00414" /><CodeLine lineNumber="414"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If crash recovery is disabled, do nothing.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00415" /><CodeLine lineNumber="415"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (gCrashRecoveryEnabled) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00416" /><CodeLine lineNumber="416"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(!Impl &amp;&amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Crash recovery context already initialized!&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00417" /><CodeLine lineNumber="417"><Highlight kind="normal">    CrashRecoveryContextImpl &#42;CRCI = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">new</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> CrashRecoveryContextImpl(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00418" /><CodeLine lineNumber="418"><Highlight kind="normal">    Impl = CRCI;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00419" /><CodeLine lineNumber="419"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00420" /><CodeLine lineNumber="420"><Highlight kind="normal">    CRCI-&gt;ValidJumpBuffer = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00421" /><CodeLine lineNumber="421"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (setjmp(CRCI-&gt;JumpBuffer) != 0) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00422" /><CodeLine lineNumber="422"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00423" /><CodeLine lineNumber="423"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00424" /><CodeLine lineNumber="424"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00425" /><CodeLine lineNumber="425"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="426"><Highlight kind="normal">  Fn();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="427"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="428"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="429"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00430" /><CodeLine lineNumber="430"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#endif </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// !&#95;MSC&#95;VER</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00431" /><CodeLine lineNumber="431"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00432" /><CodeLine lineNumber="432" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontext/#a37a76700bffd3d25b09e7828fa90277c"><Highlight kind="normal">&#91;&#91;noreturn&#93;&#93; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontext/#a37a76700bffd3d25b09e7828fa90277c">CrashRecoveryContext::HandleExit</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontext/#aa79c730e28c1406ada1243fae0e0358d">RetCode</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00433" /><CodeLine lineNumber="433"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#if defined(&#95;WIN32)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00434" /><CodeLine lineNumber="434"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Since the exception code is actually of NTSTATUS type, we use the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00435" /><CodeLine lineNumber="435"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Microsoft-recommended 14 prefix, to signify that this is a user error.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00436" /><CodeLine lineNumber="436"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This value is a combination of the customer field (bit 29) and severity</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00437" /><CodeLine lineNumber="437"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// field (bits 30-31) in the NTSTATUS specification.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00438" /><CodeLine lineNumber="438"><Highlight kind="normal">  ::RaiseException(0xE0000000 | <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontext/#aa79c730e28c1406ada1243fae0e0358d">RetCode</a>, 0, 0, NULL);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00439" /><CodeLine lineNumber="439"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00440" /><CodeLine lineNumber="440"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// On Unix we don&#39;t need to raise an exception, we go directly to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00441" /><CodeLine lineNumber="441"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// HandleCrash(), then longjmp will unwind the stack for us.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00442" /><CodeLine lineNumber="442"><Highlight kind="normal">  CrashRecoveryContextImpl &#42;CRCI = (CrashRecoveryContextImpl &#42;)Impl;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00449" /><CodeLine lineNumber="449" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontext/#a0cd4fbb22cd917e20bb699958b4339b2"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontext/#a0cd4fbb22cd917e20bb699958b4339b2">CrashRecoveryContext::isCrash</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontext/#aa79c730e28c1406ada1243fae0e0358d">RetCode</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00450" /><CodeLine lineNumber="450"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#if defined(&#95;WIN32)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00451" /><CodeLine lineNumber="451"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// On Windows, the code is interpreted as NTSTATUS. The two high bits</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00452" /><CodeLine lineNumber="452"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// represent the severity. Values starting with 2147483648 are reserved for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00453" /><CodeLine lineNumber="453"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &quot;warnings&quot;; values of 3221225472 and up are for &quot;errors&quot;. In practice, both</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00454" /><CodeLine lineNumber="454"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// are interpreted as a non-continuable signal.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00455" /><CodeLine lineNumber="455"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Code = ((unsigned)<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontext/#aa79c730e28c1406ada1243fae0e0358d">RetCode</a> &amp; 0xF0000000) &gt;&gt; 28;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00456" /><CodeLine lineNumber="456"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Code != 12 &amp;&amp; Code != 8)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00457" /><CodeLine lineNumber="457"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00458" /><CodeLine lineNumber="458"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00459" /><CodeLine lineNumber="459"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// On Unix, signals are represented by return codes of 128 or higher.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00460" /><CodeLine lineNumber="460"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Exit code 128 is a reserved value and should not be raised as a signal.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00461" /><CodeLine lineNumber="461"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontext/#aa79c730e28c1406ada1243fae0e0358d">RetCode</a> &lt;= 128)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00462" /><CodeLine lineNumber="462"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
